data.title: Ebensberger-Fisher Funeral Home
data.text:
Noble B. Van Dyke, age 90, passed away peacefully at his home near Bergheim, Texas, with his loved ones by his side on Saturday, July 3, 2010. Born in San Angelo, Texas, March 14, 1920, to Ivan David Van Dyke and Rubye Binyon Van Dyke, he grew up and attended school in Midland, Texas. He worked at Kelly Field for 27 years and moved to the Boerne area in 1966. He was a member of the First Baptist Church since 1977. His hobbies included hunting, fishing, ranching, woodworking, and singing. He loved family occasions where many family members would play guitar and sing.

He is preceded in death by his parents and his oldest son, Gary Van Dyke. He is survived by his wife, Laura Van Dyke; daughter Denise Sypesteyn; son Blake Van Dyke and wife Kelly McKay Van Dyke; son Duane Van Dyke and wife Melanie Patterson Van Dyke. His grandchildren, Lisa Craighead, Shane Van Dyke, Pieter Sypesteyn, Carrie Sypesteyn, Kyle Van Dyke, Kristen Van Dyke, Sarah Van Dyke, and Cade Van Dyke. Also his sister Bettye Stanley; brother Larry Van Dyke and wife Becky Powell and numerous niece and nephews.

A visitation will be held on Thursday, July 8, 2010, from 5-7 PM at Ebensberger-Fisher Funeral Home. The Funeral will be on Friday, July 9, 2010, at 10 AM at the First Baptist Church of Boerne. Interment will follow at the Boerne Cemetery. To leave the family a message, visit www.ebensberger-fisher.com. In lieu of flowers, the family asks that donations be made to a charity of your choice.

Arrangements with Ebensberger-Fisher Funeral Home of Boerne.
